title: Health Records Data Analyst - Health Data Resources
text:
welcome to scarborough and rouge hospital job opportunitiescareer alertsmy profilehelp health records data analyst - health data resources

to display this page you need a browser with javascript support.

addthis sharing buttonsshare to moreaddthisshare to favoritesfavoritesshare to emailemailshare to facebookfacebookshare to twittertwittershare to linkedinlinkedin job number: j1017-0208 job title: health records data analyst - health data resources department: health data resources job category: health information management campus location: general job type: full time number of positions: 1 union: non union hours: days   at scarborough and rouge hospital (srh), the patient experience comes first. with three hospital sites (birchmount, general and centenary) and five satellite sites, srh provides a broad spectrum of health services to one of the most diverse communities in canada. created through a merger of the scarborough hospital’s birchmount and general sites and rouge valley health system’s centenary site in december 2016, srh is committed to delivering the highest quality patient- and family-centred care, with a focus on enhancing access to services for the scarborough community. the completion of this online form serves as your application and will be used to determine if you meet the requirements of this position. please ensure that you have provided all pertinent information necessary to be considered for this vacancy by the close date. as a data analyst, you will report to manager of health records. the incumbent will be responsible for performing a variety of technical health information functions related to various databases within coding services. the data analyst is the liaison between the clinicians and the him professionals, ensuring data quality concerns are appropriately addressed as it relates to collection and optimization of clinical documentation. you may be scheduled at the general or birchmount campus based on departmental needs. requirements: • possess a university degree or diploma in health information management• current registration with canadian health information management association (chima)• minimum 5 years acute care inpatient(dad) coding experience in a hospital setting• knowledge of canada′s health care system with thorough understanding of cihi′s case mix grouping (cmg+) and resource intensity weight (riw) along with ontario funding reform, hbam inpatient grouper and hbam inpatient weight (hig)• thorough knowledge and understanding of mis guidelines• experience working with winrecs abstracting system and meditech• excellent skills and in depth knowledge of dad and nacrs coding to perform chart audits for qa analysis• must be proficient in scripting reports through crystal report writer for data quality and reporting purposes• responsible for pro-active and retrospective audits on coded data to ensure alignment with icd-10/cci standards and accuracy• responsible for initiating analyses related to the quality of clinical documentation and the accuracy of its subsequent collection to ensure data quality standards• develops, distributes and promotes materials with a focus on clinical documentation• the data analyst must have knowledge of providing data submission and correction files to cihi, cco and ccn• proficient in microsoft office suite (windows, excel and word)• demonstrates values consistent with tsh′s code of conduct and is committed to fostering a healthy and positive work environment in accordance with health & safety policy and legislation.• excellent communication skills with demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization and develop and maintain respectful interpersonal relations• excellent work performance, attention to detail and attendance and effective team work skills• demonstrates excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills• demonstrates a commitment to customer service when dealing with patients, colleagues and volunteers and other members of the community and public• demonstrates values consistent with srh′s code of conduct and is committed to fostering a healthy and positive work environment in accordance with health & safety policy and legislation.• demonstrates an understanding of and commitment to srh's comprehensive safety programs and practices including staff safety, patient safety, and environmental safety and participates in regular in-service education in this area.• demonstrates excellent work performance and attendance record asset: • ability to speak another language is an asset scarborough and rouge hospital (srh) embraces and celebrates our community’s unique multicultural heritage and diversity. srh is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to a culture of inclusiveness and diversity reflecting our diverse patients, staff and community alike. we are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act (aoda). should you require accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please make them known when contacted and we will work with you to meet your needs. view disclaimer © 2017 srh

project/ data coordinator 
reporting to a project manager, you will be providing support for a number of projectsinvolving environmental data collection for engineering analysis. as such, youwill be involved in various aspects of data collection and management, withresponsibilities including data cleaning/ scrubbing, data review, and dataanalysis.

duties include:• data management- assist with data flow by receiving data from the field and uploading to data management website and filing raw data as appropriate.• review and qa/qc data on a regular basis to note any issues with data quality, loss of data, etc., and scheduling field technicians for maintenance as required.• reviewing field notes and filing as appropriate. updating project managers of any issues requiring further attention.• assist in the preparation of documents and materials such as memos, reports, letters, and proposals for internal and external use.• conduct day-to-day job tasks in accordance to legislated and company-dictated environmental, health and safety mandates. • manage and coordinate other tasks and duties as required. qualifications:• degree or diploma relevant to the position, or demonstrable applicable experience• strong analytical data qa/qc skills• excellent ms excel skills• strong database skills• effective communication skills, verbal and written• ability to work effectively both independently and in a team based environment• demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities • strong multi-tasking and organizational skills• knowledge of kisters wiski platform an asset

member relations, policy development position type full time region on - metro toronto area location(s) downtown toronto career level experienced (non-manager) ad online since 10/04/2017 application deadline 10/25/2017 data analyst data analyst the council of ontario universities (cou) invites applications for the position of data analyst. representing the collective interests of ontario’s publicly-assisted universities, cou (www.cou.on.ca) promotes higher education in ontario through analysis and policy development, advocacy and communications.  reporting to the senior director, policy and analysis (senior director), the data analyst conducts analysis to provide data and quantitative analysis in support of the activities and interests of cou, its affiliates, task forces, committees or the cou senior management team. responsibilities: provide research, analysis and interpretation of financial, statistical and other quantitative data.  develop and maintain databases to compile and support analysis of complex financial, statistical, and other quantitative data; compile statistical and other quantitative reports and summaries. collect required data through surveys, government sources, member engagement, and other means; determine data requirements, information flows, and appropriate analytic methods. develop quantitative models to construct scenarios and assess financial and other impacts of various policy options. contribute advice concerning data to be compiled to support analysis, and methods for the collection of data that is not readily available. lead data development projects and develops models to assess financial and other impacts of policy options. contribute to the development of and implement proposals to improve access, accuracy and relevance of data to support policy development and advocacy. provide analytical support to cou affiliates and committees, typically for projects with a significant component of quantitative information. develop, maintain and manage excellent working relationships with partners in government, member institutions, professional organizations and other stakeholders as an integral part of carrying out the above-noted duties. liaise with member institutions with respect to collection and interpretation of data, and development of databases. education and experience:  minimum bachelor’s degree, in disciplines using quantitative analytical approaches such as economics, statistics, finance, business or public administration; master’s degree preferred. at least two (2) years working experience in quantitative analysis to support policy development and/or research; recently graduating candidates may be considered. skills: superior skills in quantitative analysis, communication of quantitative information, and research required. experience using statistical software an asset (spss, sas, minitab, r, python). experience with data visualization software an asset. familiarity with the use of quantitative analysis in a policy context an asset. familiarity with the university sector an asset. other: must have excellent oral and written communication skills. must have high-level interpersonal skills, including ability to deal with tact and diplomacy with personnel in the postsecondary sector and government. must have demonstrated ability to organize and execute. ability to assume responsibility and to work independently, prioritizing and exercising sound judgement on sensitive matters. must be able to work with several projects whose goals, schedules and deadlines converge and conflict. in this environment, must meet self-imposed deadlines and demonstrate flexibility, openness to change, ability and willingness to learn continuously. those qualified are asked to submit a cover letter with resume, outlining your experience and suitability for the position as well as salary expectations, to parecruit@cou.on.ca by 5 p.m. on october 25, 2017. information regarding cou is available at www.cou.on.ca. cou is an equal opportunity employer that values the strength diversity brings to the workplace.  we thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. cou is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process to applicants with accessibility needs in accordance with the ontario human rights code and the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act (aoda).  if you require an accommodation during this process, please inform cou of your requirements. back to search results the ministry of the economy has an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated individual with excellent data and analytical skills to fill the position of statistical analyst in the labour market information (lmi) unit of the labour market planning branch on a term basis until march 20, 2019.  
 
the position requires the ability to: work independently and within a team environment; build positive working relationships within the ministry and with other ministries and levels of government; prioritize assignments to manage a demanding and varied workload; work under tight deadlines; balance speed and accuracy; and demonstrate good written and verbal communication skills to report and present information concisely and accurately to inform and influence a variety of stakeholders.
 
the position requires an analytical, detail- and results-oriented individual to support the research, analysis, development, reporting, communication and dissemination of labour market information to inform labour market related strategies, policy and planning, and program and service delivery within the ministry, executive government and the post-secondary training, employment and immigration sector (“the sector”).
 
typically, the knowledge and skills required for this position would be acquired through completion of an undergraduate or higher degree in economics, statistics or business administration and experience working as an analyst in a strategic policy or statistical environment.we are committed to workplace diversity.hours of work:  t - sgeu non-office 36 - one day off every two weeksshift:  day jobtravel:  nocriminal record check requirement:  the successful candidate shall be subject to a criminal record check as a condition of employmentnumber of openings:  1closing date:  oct 9, 2017, 11:59:00 pm

we're in the business of helping organizations help their people, because we believe that engaged people are the driving force behind society. each day, the expertise of our 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health and productivity of our clients and their people.
we're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will embrace the long-term client relationships we value, and will listen and work together with colleagues and our clients to deliver integrative solutions that fit.
as we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in the following opportunity. if we sound like a career solutions that fits you, read on.
reporting analyst
employee support solutions
toronto, on or montreal, qc
full-time
morneau shepell's industry-leading employee assistance program supports employees and eligible family members in assessing their work, life, and health issues, and is delivered in-person, telephonically, through e-counselling, video counseling, first chat, and our myeap mobile application.
our results analysts focus on timely and accurate reporting of operations metrics to support our operations managers with their ad hoc and cyclical reporting needs.

duties and responsibilities


compiling monthly and quarterly special contracts reports


compiling monthly high level reports


compiling statistical reports on a weekly basis


compiling daily reports on case creation, service levels, and other key performance indicators


rapidly responding to operational needs by providing ad-hoc analysis with respect to agent performance, system efficiencies and process effectiveness


maintain acd reporting server


work with call centre managers to design and generate call center related reports.


assist with over-all establishment of metrics, make recommendations on measurement techniques, create/improve report templates


maintain and keep up to date the report training documentations


assist with training the new hires within the results analyst team


succeeding as a results analyst will require the following core qualifications and skills: 


post-secondary education, preferably related to statistics or mathematics


at least one-year of experience in an administrative role


advanced skills in microsoft excel with proficiency in pivot tables and formulas (e.g. v-lookup, sumifs etc.) including exposure to vba


strong multitasking, analytical, communication, and decision-making skills


ability to prioritize workloads based on need and work effectively towards deadlines


well-developed ability to assess needs, problem solve and make relevant recommendations


solid ability to understand processes and clear documentation skills


ability to work effectively both individually and as part of a tight-knit team 


at www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it, and follow us on linkedin and twitter for ongoing insight into our business growth and future career opportunities.
we are thankful for your interest in our organization, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.

title: Data Analyst & Researcher
text:
watrhub inc. - jobs: data analyst & researcher - apply online

























all jobs
→
data analyst & researcher

data analyst & researcher
toronto, ontario, canada · client success team

descriptionwatrhub accelerates sales to water utilities.canada and the united states need to rebuild their aging water infrastructure. this will cost $1 trillion over the next 20 years to replace pipes, pumps, values, treatment equipment and the software to run them all.watrhub is the only source of predictive market information on how, when, and why these water infrastructure investments will be made. our ai engine transforms millions of public documents into actionable sales leads and market insights.  manufacturers subscribe to watrhub to secure their next water utility clients and bring their advanced, efficient technologies to our aging water infrastructure.requirementswe are looking for a data analyst & researcher to work alongside the client success team to deliver high quality research reports to clients throughout the water industry. you will be capturing, analyzing and processing a wide variety of water data and continuously researching creative uses for this data. this is a 3-month contract position based out of our downtown toronto office, with the ability to work remotely after the first month.what you will accomplish deploy your proven research skills to dig deep and uncover all the documents and datasources relating to drinking water, wastewater, and other sectors of the water industry in the us and canada deliver market data, research, and intelligence into the water industry that our customers need to drive their sales processes develop and deliver customer reports to discuss market trends and insights champion the integrity of our water data by identifying ways to streamline the data aggregation and automation processes that build up our database work with the client success manager to address customer success issues and to determine solutions to improve our relationship with the clients skills & requirements passion for big data challenges, previous experience working with large datasets, collecting research and summarizing findings in reports, and keen interest to uncover gaps, issues, and solutions to address possible data quality issues ability to understand tasks well, drive projects independently, complete deadlines on time, show exceptional project organization skills, and manage tasks from several projects at once strong team player who is able to communicate well, take instructions from people constructively, and also offer insightful recommendations and advice strong attention to detail and proven research skills to uncover both qualitative and quantitative insights and research from several unconsolidated and segmented sources including databases, reports and websites from the federal, state/provincial, and municipal levels multi-disciplinary knowledge of treatment processes, infrastructure, regulations, programs, and topics in the water and wastewater industry across canada and usa prior experience in a water-related or environmental research/analyst role is ideal benefitswhy watrhub? as a member of our data team, you can influence positive change within one of the biggest societal challenges of our generation (water) and be a direct player in influencing the success of our clients the data team lives at the cross section of water, startup and data science. there is no other team like it in toronto. there is no corporate bureaucracy here. you will accomplish more here in a few months than what you would in a few years at a large technology company. you have the ability to learn and obtain support from our in-house subject matter experts, data scientists and water industry titans. we work hard. we play hard. we enjoy flexible work hours and days; you choose what hour to come in and leave; if you have appointments on a weekday, feel free to switch up your work days or hours. deadline to apply is september 8, 2017. apply today and tell us specifically why you are a great fit for this opportunity!so water you waiting for?

keeping you moving:
rsa is one of the world’s leading multinational insurance groups with over 300 years of experience and over 20 million customers worldwide.our people are committed to building a dynamic internal culture where our people love what they do and feel motivated to keep things moving – for customers, for their colleagues and as part of their own growth and development. in rsa, employing positive people is how we achieve success. you will be working in an environment that encourages you to do great work and you constantly will be faced with fresh challenges that have a direct impact on our business. we believe your personality and passion will keep rsa and our business moving forward. at rsa we have a culture that supports and rewards high performance with a competitive reward policy for top performers.  our rewards package includes competitive compensation, work / life balance, opportunities to learn and the chance to make a difference working for a worldwide industry leader.
position overview:
the analyst, research & development will be a part of the research & development unit in the pricing centre of excellence. you will support the pricing and underwriting objectives of the business through the use of advanced analytics. reporting to the manager, research & development, you will enhance our analytics capability through innovation and will embed best practices throughout pricing and underwriting analytics teams.about the pricing centre of excellence in canada: pricing sophistication is a key business priority for rsa and an important area of investment to empower us to be more competitive. as the industry landscape and customer expectations evolve, our objective is to be more sophisticated in our risk understanding and to be more agile in responding to changing customer needs by having deeper insights in our pricing. in order to bring rsa in line with best-in-class pricing capabilities, we recently created a pricing centre of excellence (coe) in canada and have substantially increased its resources. the pricing coe contains core personal lines pricing units, as well as a dedicated research and development unit. this is an exciting opportunity to join a rapidly developing team focused on driving pricing innovation and best practices in order to make a material difference to our business.
who you are:
your enthusiasm is infectious. you challenge the status quo.  you find solutions to problems.  you go the extra mile to exceed customers’ expectations.  you get things done the right way.  you represent our brand with passion and pride.  you are a team player.  you have fun and you make work fun for those working around you.
what you will achieve in this role:
•	develop new predictive models to be used for pricing and underwriting; •	drive modelling sophistication through research and analysis of advanced statistical techniques;•	design, build and maintain market-leading rating algorithms;•	develop, enhance, and promote modelling best practices, including providing training to junior analysts and other teams; •	investigate, develop, and enhance data quality and data manipulation processes;•	contribute to the development of winning pricing strategies; and•	engage, support, and influence business partners to drive pricing sophistication and deliver results
what you bring to this role:
•	university/college or master degree in actuarial science, mathematics, or statistics; •	minimum 3+ years relevant pricing/predictive analytics experience or relevant statistical experience;•	technical expertise in predictive analytics, ideally including experience with sas, r, emblem, and radar; •	out-of-the-box thinker, always striving for the next innovation; •	proven ability to turn innovative insight into implementable value-driving solutions•	demonstrated success in people, project, and relationship management;•	knowledge of property and casualty insurance; and•	outstanding communication skills (both oral and written)
other information:
applicants agree that by providing personal information in response to this ad, and otherwise in any recruitment process with rsa or its affiliated companies (the “company”) such personal information may be retained and used for a period of one (1) year from the date of this application, for the purpose of consideration for employment opportunities which may arise during that time period, unless an applicant notifies the company to the contrary.we thank all applicants. however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.we invite you to learn more about us at our career site, www.rsagroup.ca, where you can apply on line. rsa group of companies is strongly committed to diversity and welcomes applications from visible minority group members, women, aboriginal persons, and persons with disabilities, members of the lgbt community, and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.rsa group of companies will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process.if you have difficulty using our online application system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email aoda@rsagroup.ca or call us at toll free 1 (800)-855-0511. please note this email is only for accommodation requests. resumes sent to this email address will not be considered.

assetsknowledge of sql, database concepts, and bi toolsthe market we servenavarik corp. is a software and data service provider to the commodity trading industry. navarik is the industry leading, global solution that standardizes and processes operational trading and supply information for over 4000 users across 50 different countries from energy majors such as: exxonmobil, bp and chevron.the people we wantnavarik is comprised of a team of highly motivated people working together in pursuit of product excellence and service to our customers. we seek brilliant, hardworking people who want to be part of a growing team and fun environment where leading edge technology and solutions are created and successfully commercialized. every team member is empowered to learn, grow and share his or collaboratively with managers and executive management team. this individual will be responsible for managing totten’s bordereaux reports for company risk reporting and developing report templates to compliance and underwriting. this role reports to the chief underwriting officer. we offer an excellent opportunity to work for one of canada’s leading mga’s and to become part of a dynamic and knowledgeable team. role responsibilities: identifies and researches business needs and determines solutions to problems using various research methodologies. communicates and interprets data through the production of various reports. oversees the completion of totten’s various company bordereaux in an accurate and timely fashion. runs reports and interprets data for leaders and executive management team upon request by using data system available. updates data system for totten monthly using accurate parameters. works with management team and executive management team to develop valuable monthly reports. assists with special projects as required qualifications: graduate of college/university insurance program preferred up to 5 years of related technical insurance experience i.e. claims, underwriting assistant etc. mga experience an asset strong insurance reporting and research experience desired proficient in microsoft office: word, excel, powerpoint and outlook advanced skills. ability to work efficiently and effectively, utilizing good time management skills. strong teamwork and collaboration skills. knowledge of the competition and regulatory issues within the industry. totten insurance group i s canada’s leading national mga provider of niche products and innovative solutions. totten group is committed to servicing brokers across the country and is comprised of six divisions: personal lines; commercial property; commercial casualty; hospitality; construction and professional liability. with offices across canada, totten group’s corporate office resides in toronto on, and has other locations in oakville on, dartmouth ns, winnipeg mb, montreal qc, and vancouver bc. learn more at www.tottengroup.com. *li-jl location: canada, ontario, toronto title: Analyst, Investor Relations
text:
job description - analyst, investor relations (1709734)go to the main content section.welcome.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign intaleo@manulife.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - analyst, investor relations (1709734)  analyst, investor relations-1709734 description are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed?  with work that challenges and makes a difference and a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.

 
the investor relations (ir) team is primarily responsible for ongoing communication with the investment community including existing and prospective institutional shareholders, as well as sell side equity research analysts. supporting ir, the individual would assist in a number of areas including conducting industry research, peer reviews, updates to management, marketing events and institutional investor targeting. 

 
key accountabilities: 

play a contributing role to the quarter-end process: 

assist with the development of slides and speaking notes for the earnings conference call/webcast; 
lead the preparation of board reports, including summarizing the past quarter’s ir activities, progress on ir’s goals, analyst sentiment, movements in holdings and stock performance. 
summarize the street's pre- and post-call sentiment, and analysts’ reports. 
review the earnings calls of peers as part of the quarter end activities and summarize the relevant take-aways for manulife. 
lead the preparation of other quarterly deliverables such as company fact sheets. 
 assist with identifying potential earnings calls questions. 
analysis and presentations:

assist with general research and market analysis. develop a strong understanding of our web-based ir tools in order to extract required market data and conduct related financial analysis (e.g. bloomberg, ipreo, thomson one) 
assist in preparing for marketing road shows, including preparing and updating presentation materials for senior management, coordinating logistics with brokers and internal stakeholders, providing insights on priority investors to meet, and creating briefing material for senior management 
review mfc and peer communication materials to ensure mfc maintains best practice standards 
assist with ad hoc financial analysis as required 
relationship management: 

ensure call tracking / meeting databases are maintained and up-to-date 
work with ir team and financial intelligence vendors to create “target investor” reports, manage investor contacts and maintain communication calendar 
coordinate, organize and support meetings with mfc executives 
ensure best practice disclosure standards are maintained 
ownership and management of ir website and ir sharepoint 

responsible for content, “look and feel” and management of investor relations website at manulife.com 
review peers and best practice – initiate new projects to provide a best-in-class user experience 
maintain content on ir sharepoint and manage user access 
quickly become fluent in our business model, the markets we operating in, and the drivers of results
participate in ad hoc or special projects as required qualifications 
university degree in a relevant field; cpa or cfa an asset 
one to three years of progressive work experience in the financial services industry 
working understanding of the insurance business and/or manulife’s products and distribution strategies an asset 
solid analytical capability; financial modeling experience an asset; 
ability to learn quickly and adapt well to changing requirements 
strong computer and analytical skills (particularly powerpoint and excel) 
excellent time management and organizational skills. ability to work within tight and changing time constraints and to handle multiple tasks at one time 
strong writing, communication and “story telling” skills. ability to use tact and diplomacy in dealing with others 
ability to use judgment and initiative in anticipating and solving issues 
detail oriented 
key problems/challenges: 

no margin for error in disclosure of information to outsiders 
very tight deadlines — priorities can change intra-day 

about manulife

 
manulife financial corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. we operate as john hancock in the united states and manulife elsewhere. we provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. at the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. as of june 30, 2017, we had over $1 trillion (us$780 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $26.7 billion in payments to our customers.

 
our principal operations are in asia, canada and the united states where we have served customers for more than 100 years. with our global headquarters in toronto, canada, we trade as 'mfc' on the toronto, new york, and the philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in hong kong.

 
manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.   it is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment.  a human resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request an accommodation. information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.
  primary location : ca-on-torontoorganization : corp irjob posting : sep 28, 2017, 1:18:59 pmexpiry date : oct 12, 2017, 10:59:00 pmcategories : financial   taleo@manulife.com

intermediate data analyst


position overviewthis position is accountable for designing and creating various databases and reporting tools that are critical in the personal insurance pricing work space. the incumbent must have a very good understanding of database design as well as superior programming experience in sas.  the ideal candidate would also possess sound understanding of insurance terms and be able to communicate well with their data customers.accountabilities
design and maintain the structure of the actuarial databases including: understanding of data structure, creation of ad-hoc reports and be able to draw on past experience in suggesting areas for improvement
analyze, prepare and publish monthly/ongoing reports required by the personal insurance pricing team using sas and related tools, sql queries and microsoft office’s suite of products
provide relevant data to users outside of the actuarial department to assist them in performing specific analysis lead and participate in cross-functional teams to establish and ensure the accuracy and completeness of the extracted data.
depending on the qualification of the candidate and career interest, responsibility may be extended beyond data collection and into ad-hoc analysis assignments.
required qualifications, knowledge, & skills
bachelor degree in computer science or applied quantitative field (math/statistics, economics, engineering) or equivalent
minimum of 2 years working with relational databases
experience with very large datasets desired
ability to write and execute complex sql queries to extract/process data and working knowledge of sas, vba and ms office tool sets.
detail oriented, disciplined and punctual.
insurance industry experience with exposure to the data requirements of an actuarial department would be an asset
additional informationaviva canada is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities during all phases of the hiring process including the application process. if you require an accommodation because of a disability, we will work with you to meet your needs. applicants need to make their needs known in advance. if you are selected for an interview and require an accommodation, you are encouraged to advise the talent acquisition partner who will consult with you to determine an appropriate accommodation.about avivaaviva canada is one of the leading property and casualty insurance groups in the country providing home, automobile, leisure/lifestyle and business insurance to more than three million customers. a wholly-owned subsidiary of uk-based aviva plc, the company has more than 4,000 employees focused on creating a bright and sustainable future for their customers and communities.
aviva canada invests in positive change through the aviva community fund, canada’s longest running online community funding competition. since its inception in 2009, the aviva community fund has awarded $7.5 million to over 250 charities and community groups nationwide. aviva canada, bringing over 300 years of good thinking and insurance solutions to canadians from coast-to-coast.
for more information visit avivacanada.com, the company’s blog or twitter, facebook and linkedin pages.

date: 
sep 19, 2017
                


location: 
toronto, on, ca, m4y 2y5


every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for canadians. we work as one team, with one goal – serve our customers better.
 
we're looking to hire an analyst to be a part of our rogers media sales team.  as an experienced analyst, you will be responsible for improving the integrity, reporting efficiencies and accuracy of financial and operational data required for meaningful analysis across all mbu sales business units. you will get exposure to all aspects of the business and be focused on the design, build and support the team’s data analytics tools in excel, planning and data warehouse environment.  the ability to source, map and validate data in various dynamic models will be essential for success in this role.  you will also be instrumental in supporting the team with any data warehouse/it issues, process changes, and planning.
 
this dynamic position is ideal for high potential candidates who have built extensive experience in traditional finance/accounting roles and are seeking experience in a hybrid finance/operational role.  the portfolio of responsibilities is extensive and requires a well-rounded, versatile candidate capable of excelling in all areas, including planning, reporting, operational controls, strategic analysis, and system development.
 
what you’ll be doing: 

data mining and analysis for various initiatives
writing queries and transforming data into reports for use across the organization
investigating and resolving possible data corruption and discrepancies
partnering with it on data sources and tables
leading special projects / ad-hoc assignments as required
 


what you have: 

2+ years’ experience in database report development and production
advanced knowledge of sas, sql, data mining software, and macros
media knowledge is an asset

 
 
schedule: full time
shift: day
length of contract: not applicable (regular position)
work location: 1 mount pleasant (083), toronto, on 
travel requirements: none
posting category/function: sales & media
requisition id: 102785
 
why rogers?
 
as a proud canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. we’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow.
 
at rogers, we recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. we work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work:
 

simplify and innovate
take ownership of the what and the how
equip people to succeed
execute with discipline and pride
talk straight, build trust, and over deliver

 
why rogers? because we believe the best is yet to come.
 
we recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. at rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. we work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. you can also reach out to our team at rogersrecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.

member relations, policy development position type full time region on - metro toronto area location(s) downtown toronto career level experienced (non-manager) ad online since 10/04/2017 application deadline 10/25/2017 data analyst data analyst the council of ontario universities (cou) invites applications for the position of data analyst. representing the collective interests of ontario’s publicly-assisted universities, cou (www.cou.on.ca) promotes higher education in ontario through analysis and policy development, advocacy and communications.  reporting to the senior director, policy and analysis (senior director), the data analyst conducts analysis to provide data and quantitative analysis in support of the activities and interests of cou, its affiliates, task forces, committees or the cou senior management team. responsibilities: provide research, analysis and interpretation of financial, statistical and other quantitative data.  develop and maintain databases to compile and support analysis of complex financial, statistical, and other quantitative data; compile statistical and other quantitative reports and summaries. collect required data through surveys, government sources, member engagement, and other means; determine data requirements, information flows, and appropriate analytic methods. develop quantitative models to construct scenarios and assess financial and other impacts of various policy options. contribute advice concerning data to be compiled to support analysis, and methods for the collection of data that is not readily available. lead data development projects and develops models to assess financial and other impacts of policy options. contribute to the development of and implement proposals to improve access, accuracy and relevance of data to support policy development and advocacy. provide analytical support to cou affiliates and committees, typically for projects with a significant component of quantitative information. develop, maintain and manage excellent working relationships with partners in government, member institutions, professional organizations and other stakeholders as an integral part of carrying out the above-noted duties. liaise with member institutions with respect to collection and interpretation of data, and development of databases. education and experience:  minimum bachelor’s degree, in disciplines using quantitative analytical approaches such as economics, statistics, finance, business or public administration; master’s degree preferred. at least two (2) years working experience in quantitative analysis to support policy development and/or research; recently graduating candidates may be considered. skills: superior skills in quantitative analysis, communication of quantitative information, and research required. experience using statistical software an asset (spss, sas, minitab, r, python). experience with data visualization software an asset. familiarity with the use of quantitative analysis in a policy context an asset. familiarity with the university sector an asset. other: must have excellent oral and written communication skills. must have high-level interpersonal skills, including ability to deal with tact and diplomacy with personnel in the postsecondary sector and government. must have demonstrated ability to organize and execute. ability to assume responsibility and to work independently, prioritizing and exercising sound judgement on sensitive matters. must be able to work with several projects whose goals, schedules and deadlines converge and conflict. in this environment, must meet self-imposed deadlines and demonstrate flexibility, openness to change, ability and willingness to learn continuously. those qualified are asked to submit a cover letter with resume, outlining your experience and suitability for the position as well as salary expectations, to parecruit@cou.on.ca by 5 p.m. on october 25, 2017. information regarding cou is available at www.cou.on.ca. cou is an equal opportunity employer that values the strength diversity brings to the workplace.  we thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. cou is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process to applicants with accessibility needs in accordance with the ontario human rights code and the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act (aoda).  if you require an accommodation during this process, please inform cou of your requirements. back to search results the ministry of the economy has an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated individual with excellent data and analytical skills to fill the position of statistical analyst in the labour market information (lmi) unit of the labour market planning branch on a term basis until march 20, 2019.  
 
the position requires the ability to: work independently and within a team environment; build positive working relationships within the ministry and with other ministries and levels of government; prioritize assignments to manage a demanding and varied workload; work under tight deadlines; balance speed and accuracy; and demonstrate good written and verbal communication skills to report and present information concisely and accurately to inform and influence a variety of stakeholders.
 
the position requires an analytical, detail- and results-oriented individual to support the research, analysis, development, reporting, communication and dissemination of labour market information to inform labour market related strategies, policy and planning, and program and service delivery within the ministry, executive government and the post-secondary training, employment and immigration sector (“the sector”).
 
typically, the knowledge and skills required for this position would be acquired through completion of an undergraduate or higher degree in economics, statistics or business administration and experience working as an analyst in a strategic policy or statistical environment.we are committed to workplace diversity.hours of work:  t - sgeu non-office 36 - one day off every two weeksshift:  day jobtravel:  nocriminal record check requirement:  the successful candidate shall be subject to a criminal record check as a condition of employmentnumber of openings:  1closing date:  oct 10, 2017, 5:59:00 am

we're in the business of helping organizations help their people, because we believe that engaged people are the driving force behind society. each day, the expertise of our 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health and productivity of our clients and their people.
we're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will embrace the long-term client relationships we value, and will listen and work together with colleagues and our clients to deliver integrative solutions that fit.
as we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in the following opportunity. if we sound like a career solutions that fits you, read on.
reporting analyst
employee support solutions
toronto, on or montreal, qc
full-time
morneau shepell's industry-leading employee assistance program supports employees and eligible family members in assessing their work, life, and health issues, and is delivered in-person, telephonically, through e-counselling, video counseling, first chat, and our myeap mobile application.
our results analysts focus on timely and accurate reporting of operations metrics to support our operations managers with their ad hoc and cyclical reporting needs.

duties and responsibilities


compiling monthly and quarterly special contracts reports


compiling monthly high level reports


compiling statistical reports on a weekly basis


compiling daily reports on case creation, service levels, and other key performance indicators


rapidly responding to operational needs by providing ad-hoc analysis with respect to agent performance, system efficiencies and process effectiveness


maintain acd reporting server


work with call centre managers to design and generate call center related reports.


assist with over-all establishment of metrics, make recommendations on measurement techniques, create/improve report templates


maintain and keep up to date the report training documentations


assist with training the new hires within the results analyst team


succeeding as a results analyst will require the following core qualifications and skills: 


post-secondary education, preferably related to statistics or mathematics


at least one-year of experience in an administrative role


advanced skills in microsoft excel with proficiency in pivot tables and formulas (e.g. v-lookup, sumifs etc.) including exposure to vba


strong multitasking, analytical, communication, and decision-making skills


ability to prioritize workloads based on need and work effectively towards deadlines


well-developed ability to assess needs, problem solve and make relevant recommendations


solid ability to understand processes and clear documentation skills


ability to work effectively both individually and as part of a tight-knit team 


at www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it, and follow us on linkedin and twitter for ongoing insight into our business growth and future career opportunities.
we are thankful for your interest in our organization, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.

title: Data Analyst & Researcher
text:
watrhub inc. - jobs: data analyst & researcher - apply online

























all jobs
→
data analyst & researcher

data analyst & researcher
toronto, ontario, canada · client success team

descriptionwatrhub accelerates sales to water utilities.canada and the united states need to rebuild their aging water infrastructure. this will cost $1 trillion over the next 20 years to replace pipes, pumps, values, treatment equipment and the software to run them all.watrhub is the only source of predictive market information on how, when, and why these water infrastructure investments will be made. our ai engine transforms millions of public documents into actionable sales leads and market insights.  manufacturers subscribe to watrhub to secure their next water utility clients and bring their advanced, efficient technologies to our aging water infrastructure.requirementswe are looking for a data analyst & researcher to work alongside the client success team to deliver high quality research reports to clients throughout the water industry. you will be capturing, analyzing and processing a wide variety of water data and continuously researching creative uses for this data. this is a 3-month contract position based out of our downtown toronto office, with the ability to work remotely after the first month.what you will accomplish deploy your proven research skills to dig deep and uncover all the documents and datasources relating to drinking water, wastewater, and other sectors of the water industry in the us and canada deliver market data, research, and intelligence into the water industry that our customers need to drive their sales processes develop and deliver customer reports to discuss market trends and insights champion the integrity of our water data by identifying ways to streamline the data aggregation and automation processes that build up our database work with the client success manager to address customer success issues and to determine solutions to improve our relationship with the clients skills & requirements passion for big data challenges, previous experience working with large datasets, collecting research and summarizing findings in reports, and keen interest to uncover gaps, issues, and solutions to address possible data quality issues ability to understand tasks well, drive projects independently, complete deadlines on time, show exceptional project organization skills, and manage tasks from several projects at once strong team player who is able to communicate well, take instructions from people constructively, and also offer insightful recommendations and advice strong attention to detail and proven research skills to uncover both qualitative and quantitative insights and research from several unconsolidated and segmented sources including databases, reports and websites from the federal, state/provincial, and municipal levels multi-disciplinary knowledge of treatment processes, infrastructure, regulations, programs, and topics in the water and wastewater industry across canada and usa prior experience in a water-related or environmental research/analyst role is ideal benefitswhy watrhub? as a member of our data team, you can influence positive change within one of the biggest societal challenges of our generation (water) and be a direct player in influencing the success of our clients the data team lives at the cross section of water, startup and data science. there is no other team like it in toronto. there is no corporate bureaucracy here. you will accomplish more here in a few months than what you would in a few years at a large technology company. you have the ability to learn and obtain support from our in-house subject matter experts, data scientists and water industry titans. we work hard. we play hard. we enjoy flexible work hours and days; you choose what hour to come in and leave; if you have appointments on a weekday, feel free to switch up your work days or hours. deadline to apply is september 8, 2017. apply today and tell us specifically why you are a great fit for this opportunity!so water you waiting for?

keeping you moving:
rsa is one of the world’s leading multinational insurance groups with over 300 years of experience and over 20 million customers worldwide.our people are committed to building a dynamic internal culture where our people love what they do and feel motivated to keep things moving – for customers, for their colleagues and as part of their own growth and development. in rsa, employing positive people is how we achieve success. you will be working in an environment that encourages you to do great work and you constantly will be faced with fresh challenges that have a direct impact on our business. we believe your personality and passion will keep rsa and our business moving forward. at rsa we have a culture that supports and rewards high performance with a competitive reward policy for top performers.  our rewards package includes competitive compensation, work / life balance, opportunities to learn and the chance to make a difference working for a worldwide industry leader.
position overview:
the analyst, research & development will be a part of the research & development unit in the pricing centre of excellence. you will support the pricing and underwriting objectives of the business through the use of advanced analytics. reporting to the manager, research & development, you will enhance our analytics capability through innovation and will embed best practices throughout pricing and underwriting analytics teams.about the pricing centre of excellence in canada: pricing sophistication is a key business priority for rsa and an important area of investment to empower us to be more competitive. as the industry landscape and customer expectations evolve, our objective is to be more sophisticated in our risk understanding and to be more agile in responding to changing customer needs by having deeper insights in our pricing. in order to bring rsa in line with best-in-class pricing capabilities, we recently created a pricing centre of excellence (coe) in canada and have substantially increased its resources. the pricing coe contains core personal lines pricing units, as well as a dedicated research and development unit. this is an exciting opportunity to join a rapidly developing team focused on driving pricing innovation and best practices in order to make a material difference to our business.
who you are:
your enthusiasm is infectious. you challenge the status quo.  you find solutions to problems.  you go the extra mile to exceed customers’ expectations.  you get things done the right way.  you represent our brand with passion and pride.  you are a team player.  you have fun and you make work fun for those working around you.
what you will achieve in this role:
•	develop new predictive models to be used for pricing and underwriting; •	drive modelling sophistication through research and analysis of advanced statistical techniques;•	design, build and maintain market-leading rating algorithms;•	develop, enhance, and promote modelling best practices, including providing training to junior analysts and other teams; •	investigate, develop, and enhance data quality and data manipulation processes;•	contribute to the development of winning pricing strategies; and•	engage, support, and influence business partners to drive pricing sophistication and deliver results
what you bring to this role:
•	university/college or master degree in actuarial science, mathematics, or statistics; •	minimum 3+ years relevant pricing/predictive analytics experience or relevant statistical experience;•	technical expertise in predictive analytics, ideally including experience with sas, r, emblem, and radar; •	out-of-the-box thinker, always striving for the next innovation; •	proven ability to turn innovative insight into implementable value-driving solutions•	demonstrated success in people, project, and relationship management;•	knowledge of property and casualty insurance; and•	outstanding communication skills (both oral and written)
other information:
applicants agree that by providing personal information in response to this ad, and otherwise in any recruitment process with rsa or its affiliated companies (the “company”) such personal information may be retained and used for a period of one (1) year from the date of this application, for the purpose of consideration for employment opportunities which may arise during that time period, unless an applicant notifies the company to the contrary.we thank all applicants. however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.we invite you to learn more about us at our career site, www.rsagroup.ca, where you can apply on line. rsa group of companies is strongly committed to diversity and welcomes applications from visible minority group members, women, aboriginal persons, and persons with disabilities, members of the lgbt community, and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.rsa group of companies will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process.if you have difficulty using our online application system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email aoda@rsagroup.ca or call us at toll free 1 (800)-855-0511. please note this email is only for accommodation requests. resumes sent to this email address will not be considered.

valuable monthly reports. assists with special projects as required qualifications: graduate of college/university insurance program preferred up to 5 years of related technical insurance experience i.e. claims, underwriting assistant etc. mga experience an asset strong insurance reporting and research experience desired proficient in microsoft office: word, excel, powerpoint and outlook advanced title: Analyst, Investor Relations
text:
job description - analyst, investor relations (1709734)go to the main content section.welcome.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign intaleo@manulife.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - analyst, investor relations (1709734)  analyst, investor relations-1709734 description are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed?  with work that challenges and makes a difference and a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.

 
the investor relations (ir) team is primarily responsible for ongoing communication with the investment community including existing and prospective institutional shareholders, as well as sell side equity research analysts. supporting ir, the individual would assist in a number of areas including conducting industry research, peer reviews, updates to management, marketing events and institutional investor targeting. 

 
key accountabilities: 

play a contributing role to the quarter-end process: 

assist with the development of slides and speaking notes for the earnings conference call/webcast; 
lead the preparation of board reports, including summarizing the past quarter’s ir activities, progress on ir’s goals, analyst sentiment, movements in holdings and stock performance. 
summarize the street's pre- and post-call sentiment, and analysts’ reports. 
review the earnings calls of peers as part of the quarter end activities and summarize the relevant take-aways for manulife. 
lead the preparation of other quarterly deliverables such as company fact sheets. 
 assist with identifying potential earnings calls questions. 
analysis and presentations:

assist with general research and market analysis. develop a strong understanding of our web-based ir tools in order to extract required market data and conduct related financial analysis (e.g. bloomberg, ipreo, thomson one) 
assist in preparing for marketing road shows, including preparing and updating presentation materials for senior management, coordinating logistics with brokers and internal stakeholders, providing insights on priority investors to meet, and creating briefing material for senior management 
review mfc and peer communication materials to ensure mfc maintains best practice standards 
assist with ad hoc financial analysis as required 
relationship management: 

ensure call tracking / meeting databases are maintained and up-to-date 
work with ir team and financial intelligence vendors to create “target investor” reports, manage investor contacts and maintain communication calendar 
coordinate, organize and support meetings with mfc executives 
ensure best practice disclosure standards are maintained 
ownership and management of ir website and ir sharepoint 

responsible for content, “look and feel” and management of investor relations website at manulife.com 
review peers and best practice – initiate new projects to provide a best-in-class user experience 
maintain content on ir sharepoint and manage user access 
quickly become fluent in our business model, the markets we operating in, and the drivers of results
participate in ad hoc or special projects as required qualifications 
university degree in a relevant field; cpa or cfa an asset 
one to three years of progressive work experience in the financial services industry 
working understanding of the insurance business and/or manulife’s products and distribution strategies an asset 
solid analytical capability; financial modeling experience an asset; 
ability to learn quickly and adapt well to changing requirements 
strong computer and analytical skills (particularly powerpoint and excel) 
excellent time management and organizational skills. ability to work within tight and changing time constraints and to handle multiple tasks at one time 
strong writing, communication and “story telling” skills. ability to use tact and diplomacy in dealing with others 
ability to use judgment and initiative in anticipating and solving issues 
detail oriented 
key problems/challenges: 

no margin for error in disclosure of information to outsiders 
very tight deadlines — priorities can change intra-day 

about manulife

 
manulife financial corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. we operate as john hancock in the united states and manulife elsewhere. we provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. at the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. as of june 30, 2017, we had over $1 trillion (us$780 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $26.7 billion in payments to our customers.

 
our principal operations are in asia, canada and the united states where we have served customers for more than 100 years. with our global headquarters in toronto, canada, we trade as 'mfc' on the toronto, new york, and the philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in hong kong.

 
manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.   it is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment.  a human resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request an accommodation. information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.
  primary location : ca-on-torontoorganization : corp irjob posting : sep 28, 2017, 1:18:59 pmexpiry date : oct 12, 2017, 10:59:00 pmcategories : financial   taleo@manulife.com

intermediate data analyst


position overviewthis position is accountable for designing and creating various databases and reporting tools that are critical in the personal insurance pricing work space. the incumbent must have a very good understanding of database design as well as superior programming experience in sas.  the ideal candidate would also possess sound understanding of insurance terms and be able to communicate well with their data customers.accountabilities
design and maintain the structure of the actuarial databases including: understanding of data structure, creation of ad-hoc reports and be able to draw on past experience in suggesting areas for improvement
analyze, prepare and publish monthly/ongoing reports required by the personal insurance pricing team using sas and related tools, sql queries and microsoft office’s suite of products
provide relevant data to users outside of the actuarial department to assist them in performing specific analysis lead and participate in cross-functional teams to establish and ensure the accuracy and completeness of the extracted data.
depending on the qualification of the candidate and career interest, responsibility may be extended beyond data collection and into ad-hoc analysis assignments.
required qualifications, knowledge, & skills
bachelor degree in computer science or applied quantitative field (math/statistics, economics, engineering) or equivalent
minimum of 2 years working with relational databases
experience with very large datasets desired
ability to write and execute complex sql queries to extract/process data and working knowledge of sas, vba and ms office tool sets.
detail oriented, disciplined and punctual.
insurance industry experience with exposure to the data requirements of an actuarial department would be an asset
additional informationaviva canada is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities during all phases of the hiring process including the application process. if you require an accommodation because of a disability, we will work with you to meet your needs. applicants need to make their needs known in advance. if you are selected for an interview and require an accommodation, you are encouraged to advise the talent acquisition partner who will consult with you to determine an appropriate accommodation.about avivaaviva canada is one of the leading property and casualty insurance groups in the country providing home, automobile, leisure/lifestyle and business insurance to more than three million customers. a wholly-owned subsidiary of uk-based aviva plc, the company has more than 4,000 employees focused on creating a bright and sustainable future for their customers and communities.
aviva canada invests in positive change through the aviva community fund, canada’s longest running online community funding competition. since its inception in 2009, the aviva community fund has awarded $7.5 million to over 250 charities and community groups nationwide. aviva canada, bringing over 300 years of good thinking and insurance solutions to canadians from coast-to-coast.
for more information visit avivacanada.com, the company’s blog or twitter, facebook and linkedin pages.

date:

toronto, on, ca, m4y 2y5


every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for canadians. we work as one team, with one goal – serve our customers better.
 
we're looking to hire an analyst to be a part of our rogers media sales team.  as an experienced analyst, you will be responsible for improving the integrity, reporting efficiencies and accuracy of financial and operational data required for meaningful analysis across all mbu sales business units. you will get exposure to all aspects of the business and be focused on the design, build and support the team’s data analytics tools in excel, planning and data warehouse environment.  the ability to source, map and validate data in various dynamic models will be essential for success in this role.  you will also be instrumental in supporting the team with any data warehouse/it issues, process changes, and planning.
 
this dynamic position is ideal for high potential candidates who have built extensive experience in traditional finance/accounting roles and are seeking experience in a hybrid finance/operational role.  the portfolio of responsibilities is extensive and requires a well-rounded, versatile candidate capable of excelling in all areas, including planning, reporting, operational controls, strategic analysis, and system development.
 
what you’ll be doing: 

data mining and analysis for various initiatives
writing queries and transforming data into reports for use across the organization
investigating and resolving possible data corruption and discrepancies
partnering with it on data sources and tables
leading special projects / ad-hoc assignments as required
 


what you have: 

2+ years’ experience in database report development and production
advanced knowledge of sas, sql, data mining software, and macros
media knowledge is an asset

 
 
schedule: full time
shift: day
length of contract: not applicable (regular position)
work location: 1 mount pleasant (083), toronto, on 
travel requirements: none
posting category/function: sales & media
requisition id: 102785
 
why rogers?
 
as a proud canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. we’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow.
 
at rogers, we recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. we work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work:
 

simplify and innovate
take ownership of the what and the how
equip people to succeed
execute with discipline and pride
talk straight, build trust, and over deliver

 
why rogers? because we believe the best is yet to come.
 
we recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. at rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. we work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. you can also reach out to our team at rogersrecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.

data analyst (adv00064)job description business data analyst - adv00064 role summarythis is an opportunity to join a growing business analytics team; a group of exceedingly savvy and intellectually curious professionals who are transforming business intelligence at sun life financial (slf) canada. the business data analyst’s primary focus is supporting the plans and objectives of canadian operations by applying critical thinking and advanced statistics to find unexpected relationships and anomalies in a vast variety of data sources.  the incumbent will be responsible for supporting new initiatives, reports, enhancements and/or projects, which includes design, development and implementation.  core responsibilitiesresponsible for understanding business processes in order to research, analyze, interpret and advise on findings  and make recommendations including assessing performance and capability of processes (throughput, cycle time, productivity, waste, etc.)identify opportunities and champion proposals for improvement (value stream analysis, business case, etc.) analyze data to identify root causes of client, operational, and financial issues in order to support recommendations, priorities and action planscollaborate with business partners to ensure effective use of reporting and analysis develop analysis and reporting tools to support leaders' accurate and timely assessment of productivity opportunities in the method that best supports the business.  ensure analysis/toolset meets the requirements of partners and provide recommendations on the direction of the reporting toolset participate in the technical design, development, and testing of analysis/reports and in the creation of user documentation and processes responsible for maintaining and improving operational reporting including new development in accordance to best practicesproactively identifies opportunities to optimize the usability, quality and timely delivery of business reportsproficient in data investigation and compilation within multiple data sourcesrecommends best solutions incorporating elimination, re-allocation or simplification of datacollaborates with colleagues across the organization to achieve resultscompentenciesbuilds context by pushing beyond "how things are done" to understand "why" and uncover the underlying principles shaping the businessability to extract, manipulate and simplify data through a variety of tools and techniquesdraws out meaningful business insights by synthesizing information from multiple sources (interviews, reports, raw data, etc.)knowledge and proficiency with sql, including the ability to build and test queriesstrong analytical, problem solving, and process improvement skills with a demonstrated ability to produce meaningful results from datathorough understanding of itil processes incident/change/release management methodologieshighly motivated individual who is able to learn quickly and execute independentlyproven ability to work collaboratively within a cross-functional team environmentstrong written and oral communications skills with experience in relating complex concepts to non-technical userspositive attitude to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and quickly find alternative solutions to challengesattention to detail  and in-depth planning, organizational and time management skills expert knowledge in the ms suite of applications (excel, word, etc)additional assets:previous investigative experience and/or knowledge of criminal intelligence analytical methodspractical experience with microsoft sql server (ssis, ssas, ssrs)familiarity and practical experience with dimensional data modeling and tableaufamiliarity with “big data” platforms (r, python, hadoop, spark, etc) and statistical tools like matlab, mathematica, maple or sasworking knowledge of scrum development practicesknowledge of group benefits, individual insurance, disability or group retirement services products and systemsbehavioral skillscollaborates effectively; drives collaboration among team members in his / her function, presenting a supportive, united front when appropriatecommunicates confidently; communicates crisply and candidly, communicates effectively across audiences (reporting managers, peers, business partners), balances talking and listening to
