title: CA - Advertising Research Entry-Level Analyst
text:
careers | ipsos




























 











ipsos.caaccueiloffres d'emploisenglish





 

offres d'emploisrecherche de postes disponiblesactualiser votre profilcréer un agent de recherchemettre à jour un agent de recherchelogin d’agence de recrutement
  



votre session expirera dans 5 minute(s).  cliquez sur ok pour poursuivre votre candidature.

















					9/28/2017
				

					ca - advertising research entry-level analyst
				


						code de suivi
					

						12216 
					

						description de l'offre
					

at ipsos, we make market research work. we know numbers. we understand people. and we succeed in delivering results. that’s why so many of the world’s leading brands and organizations look to us for their research needs.
operating in over 80 countries, we’re a global leader in survey-based market research and one of the fastest-growing and most successful firms in the business. our research focuses on five areas of specialty – advertising, marketing, public opinion, loyalty, and media – and our work focuses on our people and our clients.
sound like the right place for your career? share our passion. share our success. and join us in being proud to be ipsos.
 
research analyst - toronto, on
connect (advertising research) division
*those interested are encouraged to apply as soon as possible*
 
ipsos connect specializes in measuring and amplifying how media, brands and people connect through compelling content, great communication and relevant media planning so that clients can build great campaigns, that impact brand success both through sales and boosting brand relationships, and great content to attract audiences and deliver economic value for media owners and advertisers alike. our solutions put people at the heart of strategy for media and advertisers.
 
position summary
as a research analyst, you will play a key supporting role in the delivery of our research services and strategic insights to our clients. this is an excellent entry-level opportunity for a candidate who is intellectually curious and has a passion for delivering actionable research-based solutions.
 
key responsibilities

support senior team members on all aspects of the research process from start to finish
monitor project schedule and update senior team members on progress
work collaboratively with other team members and internal departments to ensure smooth operation of all aspects of the study
stay abreast of our key internal operations groups to enable and facilitate quality data collection (sampling, data collection and data processing)
conduct quality checks throughout the research study life-cycle (data verification, finalizing questionnaires, assisting with client presentation and reports, etc.)
assist in the development of reports and client deliverables
support management and solve project issues as they arise

 
ideal candidate has the following skills & experience

completed bachelor’s degree education level - marketing or market research specialization an asset
1+ years of market research experience an asset
fluency in spanish an asset but not required
experience in the financial services industry an asset but not required
ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining a strong client service orientation
highly motivated, self-directed & possess a driven personality capable of working within tight deadlines
data savvy with a strong attention to detail and accuracy
thrives in a team environment
excellent written & verbal communication skills

 
ipsos makes a difference
our people see to that. we attract the best talent and serve the best clients. ipsos offers a dynamic work environment where your talents are nurtured and your skills are enriched. we encourage initiative, innovation and risk-taking to further develop our business and our people. we are enthusiastic, confident and results oriented which is why our clients come to us. that’s what makes us proud to be ipsos.
 
how to apply
interested in joining a premier organization committed to satisfying our clients beyond their expectations? please submit a detailed resume that demonstrates you have the experience and abilities we are seeking by submitting an application with your resume online (button provided below). those interested are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.
 
ipsos is committed to equity in employment and in providing a workplace environment that treats all employees with respect and dignity. we are committed to providing equal opportunity to all staff and applicants.
 
we thank all applicants; however, due to the volume of applications, only those short-listed for an interview will be contacted. no phone calls, please.

title: Junior Data Scientist
text:
junior data scientist - adlib software - job board go to our website » « go back to job listings junior data scientist location: burlington, ontario, canada department: r&d type: full time min. experience: entry level at adlib, we are redefining the future of content management. we've displaced gorillas in the market with a focus on customer service and success. we are adding to our suite of offerings, building a new product with a unique approach to data insights. like most tech companies, adlib started small, in response to a problem our co-founders experienced as business leaders. they recognized a need for rapidly generated solutions to leverage the value in unstructured data. but unlike most tech companies, those original co-founders continue to be directly involved in the daily operations of the company as ceo, vp r&d and vp customer success. they've built adlib on three pillars of strength that measure our success: product innovation. we build up from our roots, improvising - adlibbing - solutions to client document and data management problems. customer relationships. we have a dedicated focus on creating a positive customer experience that stands out from everyone else. truly engaged and passionate team. that's where you come in. who you are you are obsessed with solving big data problems and determining value of dark data. you want to be fully immersed in an r&d role where you can push the boundaries of knowledge and innovate new solutions to be patented. you are looking for a role where you can leverage your knowledge and our technologies to give meaning and make decisions around unstructured data. you want to use research, natural language processing, machine learning and artificial intelligence to solve data science challenges. you want an opportunity to drive forward the creation of algorithms that will become part of the adlib elevate platform and have a significant impact on thousands of organizations across the globe. there are very few roles like this one out there. our new jr. data scientist will work with: big data. collect, ingest, store and analyze large datasets from structured and unstructured data. transform and convert unstructured dataset into structured data products. best practices. identify and evaluate standardized methods, best practices, models and algorithms to solve the problems. machine learning. research and develop new machine learning techniques and algorithms to address needs. train and build machine learning models to meet goals. experiments. test and validate the solutions. apply the latest technologies in modeling and data mining to the the experiments insights. use data mining techniques and build statistical models to classify and perform data extraction from content. knowledge sharing. document methods and algorithms used in solutions. you will: collaborate. work closely with engineering colleagues to design, build and test new and improved solutions. our new jr. data scientist has: phd in computer science or related field such as mathematics or statistics proven track record of delivering high quality analytics insights and solutions on unstructured data practical expertise using: clustering, regression and classification machine learning techniques data visualization tools distributed big data stores (e.g. hadoop or others) working with tb+ scale datasets statistical modeling, data mining, pattern recognition and search ranking experience designing machine learning pipeline expert knowledge of algorithms and data structures   strong programming skills: python, java, .net or equivalent experience designing, conducting, analyzing and interpreting experiments outstanding critical thinking, creativity, communication and problem solving skills why join adlib? our employees, new and not-so-new, tell us we excel at transparency and work-life balance. and while those may be buzzwords used to attract attention, we actually live them. how do we know this? a significant portion of our team has been here for longer than 10 years. in the tech industry, that's rare. we have people who leave and come back because they miss the culture and our team spirit. but, having said that, we aren't perfect at everything. we're continuously working on change management - we've lost count of how many whiteboards we have. we don't have all of the processes we'd like to, but that means that this is the place to get your hands dirty, come up with your own processes and work without a net. while this might be common in silicon valley, in the suburbs of toronto, it's rare and greatly appreciated to have an open-vacation policy and to promote employee wellness. we have massage therapist days, badminton, baseball, fresh fruit in the lunchroom and fitness membership reimbursement. our burlington, ontario location translates to minimal commute time and maximum family time and productivity time. if you aren't stuck in traffic, worried about being late for a professional or personal commitment, life is just less stressful and work is more enjoyable. adlib software is revolutionizing the way organizations think about their content, join us to be part of that change. apply now or follow us on twitter, facebook or linkedin. adlib seeks to inspire and nurture the human spirit - we understand that each person brings a distinct life experience to the table. embracing diversity not only enhances our work culture but drives business success. adlib encourages applications from everybody, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. forward this position recipient email address (one) your name your email address enter a message (optional) privacy & terms

text:
job description - jr. technical analyst (jan2018co-op33)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - jr. technical analyst (jan2018co-op33)  jr. technical analyst - jan2018co-op33 junior technical analyst 
toronto, ont. 
 
interested in being a part of a
team that is leading the evolution of retail in canada?
 
embracing and driving change is
critical to canadian tire’s success. the complexity and rate at which the
retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and
we are committed to being a leader in the industry. as such we are relentlessly
focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new
technologies and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward.
it is an especially exciting time to join canadian tire.
 
our it team plays a critical
role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where
digital complements the physical.  our
commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are
using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store,
online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences,
driving traffic, and boosting loyalty.  
 
what you’ll do
 
in
this role, the successful candidate will collaborate with canadian tire it
application and support teams in the design, development, and deployment of
integration components for business solutions. at canadian tire, we have
implemented an enterprise services bus framework for connecting applications
and services based on ibm’s websphere message broker.
 
in its simplest form,
the enterprise service bus (esb) enables applications to share data in a
consistent and well-understood manner. 
the esb insulates and decouples applications from one another and
simplifies the task of connecting applications.
 
leveraging
your knowledge of technology you will develop your skills in the discipline of
enterprise application integration (eai) as well as in the business areas of
digital, supply chain, merchandising, and finance. you will become familiar
with application to application, and business to business integration.  you will develop an understanding and
appreciation for it architecture as it relates to the integration discipline.
 
you
will participate in pushing forward the strategic agenda for the integration
architecture team through your assignments on technology and business projects.
 
the integration specialist is responsible for
delivering quality solutions for our business clients (through the entire
system development lifecycle), which include the following:
 
·       
ensuring all assigned deliverables (specs, working code ) are completed
as per plan, on schedule, on budget, and with quality ( with supervision )
·       
ensuring all deliverables conform to corporate standards
·       
ensuring all documentation is accurate, clear, and complete conforming to
standards.  
·       
ensuring requirements for the project are met.
·       
keep project manager/team leader up to date on progress.
·       
other duties when assigned
 
who you are
 
we are
looking for talented individuals who:
·       
thrive solving problems and are able to balance and prioritize activities

·       
drive innovation with their ‘think outside of the box’ mindset
·       
take initiative and are able to successfully manage projects 
·       
build relationships easily, and are collaborative team players with
strong communication skills
 
what you’ve done
 
·       
strong analytical and problem solving skills.
·       
excellent communications skills (verbal and written), along with the
ability to prepare / present data.
·       
exposure to sharepoint.
·       
microsoft office skills.
·       
java ( nice to have )
·       
self-starter
 
why us
 
canadian tire is one of canada’s
most iconic and diversified companies. 
our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and
commitment to our local communities through jumpstart and soldier on cannot be
beat.  
 
launch your career at canada’s
most trusted and innovative retailer.
 
this position is subject to the
successful completion of the following pre-employment conditions: 
 
·       
reference
checks 
·       
criminal
background checks 
 
apply online: campus.canadiantire.ca
                canadian tire  is an equal opportunity employer. we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. we recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. if you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. all accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. canadian tire corporationontario-torontoco-opfull-timeunposting date: ongoing

title: Data Analyst
text:
data analyst | inliv

























enter your email address to begin your application for this job.

forgot your password?



 






share this job:





data analyst

company:
        inliv
      

location:
      calgary, ab
    

type:
      full-time
    

description:
as the data analyst at inliv inc., you will work closely with the chief data officer to build our business intelligence platform.  you will be responsible for managing all aspects of inliv's data including inputting, integrity, integration, manipulation, analytics and reporting.
you will perform impact assessments related to technology choices, design / architectural considerations and implementation strategy and provide recommendations
the data analytics team will support the leadership team to create innovative data and analytics driven solutions.
your day-to-day will include:

acquire, transform and analyze data from multiple sources ensuring data quality
responsible for defining, developing, and evolving data science related tasks using the latest development methods and infrastructure
participate in normal analytics development activities like design, implementation, reviews, defect management, document handling, etc.
support impact assessments and decisions related to technology choices, design /architectural considerations and implementation strategy
collaborate with system engineers and software developers to implement solutions that are aligned with our stakeholder’s and our own strategic directions
lead the design and creation of appropriate reporting and dashboarding for use by individual departments as well as company leadership
partner with the marketing, sales and operations teams to deliver data insights, identify trends and opportunities, make suggestions for improvement and answer business questions
influence business decision making through data-based recommendations
prepare ad-hoc analysis in the support of specific initiatives as required

qualifications:

4-6 years of experience in data analytics and business reporting
bachelor degree in computer science, math, physics, applied economics or statistics
demonstrated ability to communicate in a way that is easy to understand by all stakeholders both verbally and written
proficiency with python, r, sql and tableau for data visualization
demonstrated etl skills/experience (extract, transform, load)
ability to grasp the essence of large data sets and can use and create analytical and/or statistical methods to find solutions
an eagerness to roll up your sleeves, dig deep and get the work done
experience building dashboards in common visualization tools
prior experience of working with cross functional teams
competent programming attitude with good computation and data mining skills
technical expertise, domain knowledge, experience in statistical/modeling techniques, focused on the big data space
ability and willingness to learn new technologies and methods
business oriented mindset

in order to apply, we ask you that you take the time to add a customized cover letter that clearly demonstrates what skills you have and where you have obtained them - simply add it as page 1 to your resume so that it is sent in one clear document. in addition, please add a brief paragraph as to why you want to work at inliv.
any resumes that do not include a cover letter will not be considered as this is a key piece of our recruitment methodology. we want to ensure our candidates can follow instructions and communicate clearly in a written format.

	treasury board of canada secretariat

ottawa (ontario)














ec-03, ec-04





	
	




  indeterminate and determinate





	
	ec-03 salary: $63,428 to $71,769 and ec-04 salary: $68,468 to $79,234



	for further information on the organization, please visit treasury board of canada secretariat
closing date:


	
	10 october 2017 - 23:59, pacific time
	

who can apply:




 
 
persons residing in canada and canadian citizens residing abroad. 
 
 





















apply online


important messages
note that this advertisement was originally posted as selection process number: 2017-tbd-ea-ba-102962.only applications received directly via the system (https://www.canada.ca/en/public-service-commission/jobs/services/public-service-jobs.html) will be accepted. if you require accommodation for any reason, you must contact the hr advisor listed below before the closing date. if you do not clearly demonstrate how you meet all screening criteria, your application will be rejected. your application may also be rejected if it has incomplete information. we will not contact you to request information that is missing from your application
work environmentare you a data-driven problem solver with a solid foundation in math or computer science? are you intellectually curious, self-motivated, and possess strong business acumen? the treasury board of canada secretariat is looking for motivated data scientists to join a multidisciplinary team dedicated to improving transparency and openness in government reporting through the tbs infobase—a searchable online database providing financial and human resources information on government of canada operations.the successful candidate will, among other things, work to create data visualizations and new data systems, integrate existing data systems to create intelligence, use new technologies to extract more value from existing data and automate analysis which is currently done manually.the treasury board of canada secretariat (tbs) is a central agency located in the national capital region. working at tbs offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the work of a central federal agency, and to be part of cultivating the federal public service as a model workplace. with high-performing teams and innovative practices, tbs professionals in various fields serve canadians by collaborating on government-wide initiatives, driving excellence in people management and taking initiative while effectively managing risks.if you are a leader, a motivator and a strategic thinker who wants to work for one of canada’s top employers, consider joining the tbs team.
intent of the process

		anticipatory process - a pool of qualified persons resulting from this process will be created and may be used to fill similar positions with linguistic profiles (english essential, french essential, bilingual imperative bbb/bbb, bilingual imperative cbc/cbc, bilingual non-imperative bbb/bbb, bilingual non-imperative cbc/cbc) as well as tenures (indeterminate, deployment, acting, assignment, secondment, specified period) which may vary according to the position being staffed.this pool will be used to staff similar positions in other organizations within the core public administration (http://www.psc-cfp.gc.ca/plcy-pltq/rfli-lirf/index-eng.htm).by applying to this process, you consent to your personal application-related information being shared with other government departments interested in staffing similar positions.



positions to be filled:





number to be determined







information you must provide

  
  
    your résumé.
  

  
  

  
  

  
  
  
  

  
  

  
  

  you must meet all essential qualifications in order to be appointed to the position. other qualifications may be a deciding factor in choosing the person to be appointed. some essential and other qualifications will be assessed through your application. it is your responsibility to provide appropriate examples that illustrate how you meet each qualification. failing to do so could result in your application being rejected.

in order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)education:graduation with a degree from a recognized post-secondary institution with acceptable specialization in economics, sociology or statistics.candidates must always have a degree. the courses* for the specialization must be acceptable and may have been taken at a recognized post-secondary institution, but not necessarily within a degree program in the required specialization. the specialization may also be obtained through an acceptable combination of education, training and/or experience.*note that the course requirement can be attained in programs such as: mathematics, computer science, data science/data analytics, accounting, demography/population studies, environmental sciences, epidemiology, geology, and/or finance.degree equivalencyexperience common to both streams:-experience in large scale* data management, validation, cleaning and categorizing as well as database development, data mining and data analysis, including recent** experience with tools such as python, r, sas, or sql.*large scale is based on data records numbering in the thousands or above.**recent is defined as experience normally acquired within the last three (3) years.the following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)various language requirements-bilingual imperative bbb/bbb and cbc/cbc;-bilingual non-imperative bbb/bbb and cbc/cbc;-english essential;-french essential.information on language requirementsec-03 stream:experience in any one (1) of the following: -recent** experience using programming languages (such as python, r, javascript, ruby or sas) to develop data visualizations;-experience undertaking research and analysis to produce reports summarizing empirical findings;-experience in using machine learning methodologies to solve problems.ec-04 stream:-recent** experience in using programming languages (python, r, javascript, ruby, or sas) to develop data visualizations;-experience in undertaking research and analysis to produce reports summarizing empirical findings;-experience in using machine learning methodologies to solve problems. **recent is defined as experience normally acquired within the last three (3) years.knowledge:-knowledge of programming languages (such as python, r, javascript, ruby, sas, or sql) and techniques used to analyze and present complex data to non-technical audiences.abilities:-ability to analyze and present complex data to non-technical audiences using programming languages and related techniques;-ability to build and maintain professional relationships;-ability to communicate effectively in writing;-ability to communicate effectively orally.personal suitability:-creative thinking;-reliability; -flexibility;-initiative.the following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job)asset qualificationseducation:one or more of the following:(1) a graduate or post-graduate degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial mathematics, data science, computer science, applied finance, or engineering.(2) university-level courses in any of the following: -data mining;-data warehousing;-business intelligence and data visualizations; -data analytics;-geo-spatial analysis. (3) certifications relevant to the field including:-chartered public accountant (cpa);-chartered financial analyst (cfa);-certified analytics professional (cap);-cloudera certified professional: data scientist (ccp:ds);-emc: data science associate (emcdsa).degree equivalencyexperience:-recent* experience working with the wet (web experience toolkit) and wcag 2.0 guidelines for accessibility;-experience in policy development or program delivery in an area that spans the government of canada’s responsibilities (e.g. infrastructure, it infrastructure, procurement, indigenous peoples, veterans, students, etc.);-experience working with government of canada expenditure management or people management data;-experience working with unstructured data such as text, social media, video feeds or audio;-recent* experience working in a collaborative developer/information technology (it) professional environment to automate the process of software delivery and infrastructure changes (for example dev ops);-experience working with big data including use of technologies such as distributed calculation, distributed databases, and hadoop;-experience in developing and supporting the implementation of business rules, standards, policies, guidelines or processes related to one or more of the following: data access, creation, production, storage, dissemination or evaluation of data/metadata;-working with and structuring large scale** geo-coded data for analysis and presentation;-experience working with any of the following: spss, java, perl, c/c++, hadoop, d3, shiny, tableau, and/or powerbi.*recent is defined as experience normally acquired within the last three (3) years.**large scale is based on data records numbering in the thousands or above.organizational needs:-treasury board secretariat employees affected by workforce adjustment may be appointed before persons employed by other government organizations.-in support of achieving a diverse workforce, consideration may be given to candidates self-identifying as belonging to one of the following employment equity groups: aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and women.operational requirements: -willingness to work overtime on short notice;-willingness to travel occasionally.conditions of employmentvarious security levels: -reliability status security clearance;-secret security clearance.
other information
we will communicate with you about this process by email. as a result, you must update your public service resourcing system profile if it changes. applicants should use an email address that accepts messages from unknown senders (some email systems block such messages).if you do not respond to our communications, we will interpret this as your withdrawal from the process.candidates may be required to meet the asset qualifications or the organizational needs, depending on the requirements of the specific position being staffed.reference checks will be sought.an interview will be administered.a test will be administered.please identify clearly for which position(s) you are submitting an application.you must provide proof of your education credentials.persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of their choice.you must indicate on your application if you require a technical aid for testing or an alternative method of assessment.
the public service of canada is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of canadian society. as a result, it promotes employment equity and encourages candidates to indicate voluntarily on their application if they are a woman, an aboriginal person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group.
the public service of canada is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. if contacted in relation to a job opportunity or testing, you should advise the public service commission or the departmental official in a timely fashion of the accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.
preference
preference will be given to veterans and to canadian citizens, in that order.

toronto, on $40,000 a year a local market research start-up is looking for an analyst position in downtown toronto.we are a small team of 3 full-time employees + several part-time remote workers.we have built a solid customer base and are looking to expand and grow our brand in the coming year. get in at the ground floor with room for growth - this position will be an essential part of helping our business grow and reach the next level.the role will involve working on projects for a wide variety of tier 1 & 2 companies across north america.we offer a wide variety of survey consulting services and develop reporting models/frameworks to turn their data into actionable results.starting salary$40k per year + standard benefitsjob descriptionposition: data analyst / project managerlocation: toronto, onduration: full timeresponsibilities- interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports- acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems- identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets- filter and “clean” data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems- work closely with a small team to prioritize business and information needs - careers at densify™








we are always looking for outstanding candidates to join our team. densify is fast  paced and results driven, embodying the motto "work hard, play hard." we encourage our staff to achieve  their personal career goals and will work together to find a healthy balance between work and life. densify is an equal opportunity employer and offers competitive salaries, a full range of benefits, training,  development program, and extended healthcare.

engineering & product management
technical support analyst
department: engineering
level: intermediate to senior
location: richmond hill, on 
we are currently seeking a technically dynamic and resourceful individual who has the ability to provide exceptional technical customer support in a challenging and rewarding environment.  the ideal candidate will have a combination of a strong technical background, experience working with customers and experience supporting a technical software product. 
the technical support analyst is the first point of contact for densify customers and as such, excellent communication skills and strong customer service focus are crucial for success in this role.
this is a full time position that requires shift flexibility including possible evenings, weekends and overnight shifts.
general responsibilities:  

represent densify acting as first point of contact for all technical inquiries regarding the densify product
resolve reported customer issues in the areas of system configuration, setup, product functionality, and enhancements. this includes troubleshooting, testing, referral to other service areas and follow-up
work with managed service and densify customers managing their densify infrastructure
manage escalations from customers and partners and ensure densify remains strong in its commitment to its customers’ success
accurately document customer requests using a ticket tracking system
provide focused communication with customers/partners that is professional and timely, primarily via telephone or e-mail
create and maintain accurate and up-to-date knowledgebase and documentation to share with team members
promote teamwork and customer support centre success
play an active role in the development of the organization by participating in process development and other business improvement projects
may require work outside of normal office hours and/ or 24x7 on-call availability on a rotational basis
occasional travel may be required

requirements:

4-6 (intermediate) / 6-8+ (senior) years experience supporting customers and service partners
ability to adopt and learn new technologies 
excellent unix shell programming skills 
working experience in troubleshooting windows and unix environments
strong problem analysis and solution design ability 
above average communication skills and inter-personal skills 
good understanding of all product features and good skills in explaining features to customers
experience in operating across multiple computer platforms and environments 


nice to have:

good understanding of database and middleware administration
good understanding of server consolidation and virtualization technology (vmware, hyper-v, etc.) and best practices
experience using puppet is a definite asset
good understanding of datacenter architecture and configuration
experience supporting large customers and service partners
ability to understand densify product features and explain features to customers

 if you are interested is this position, please submit your resume by email to careers@densify.com.
            in the subject title please quote cssupp:2016. electronic correspondence only – no agencies or telephone calls please. 
we thank all applicants who apply, but only qualified candidates will be contacted directly to schedule an interview.
 
scrum product owner
department: software development
location: richmond hill, on
we are seeking a scrum product owner for densify. this person will join the software development team and be responsible for defining and detailing feature requirements via user stories. this person will work with a number of groups in the organization including product management, software development, and the client services team.
the position requires strong conceptual and analysis skills, planning abilities, sound judgment, teamwork, leadership, innovation, excellent writing skills, and superior communication and presentation skills. 
general responsibilities:

work closely with product managers to define features that meet customer and market needs
work closely with scrum teams who will develop software according to your user stories
work closely with cross-functional teams composed of engineering, product management, client services, and executives to communicate and manage product deliverables
conduct user acceptance testing of all new functionality
interact with customers in beta programs and deployments
work with the software documentation team to understand features as they are developed
work with client services team members and the training service department to update and develop training materials

qualifications:

3+ years’ experience as a scrum product owner or technical business analyst 
knowledge of diverse virtualization technologies (vmware, ibm lpars, ovm, hyperv, etc.)
knowledge of windows and unix operating systems
understanding of capacity planning and performance management concepts and familiarity with solutions available in the market
demonstrated ability to understand a complex distributed software system
ability to manage multiple priorities, commitments and projects
ui design and usability experience is highly valued
prior software development experience is a benefit
experience with enterprise server consolidation, virtualization or cloud migration projects or management/operations of virtualized environments would be a major benefit
must be able to grasp highly technical concepts quickly, develop content, and independently document features for target audiences 
strong oral communication skills and excellent technical writing skills
strong team player and enjoys working in a fast paced team atmosphere
a b.s. or m.s. in computer science or a related field is strongly preferred

 if you are interested is this position, please submit your resume by email to careers@densify.com.
            in the subject title please quote scrum product owner. electronic correspondence only – no agencies or telephone calls please. 
we thank all applicants who apply, but only qualified candidates will be contacted directly to schedule an interview.
 
technical writer 
department: product management
reports to: vp, product management
location: richmond hill, on
            level: intermediate
a highly motivated “tech-savvy” technical writer. the ideal candidate will have experience working for a fast-paced, medium-sized software company. this person must have excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills. 
general responsibilities:

work with product management, engineering, services and qa to fully understand and document new features and enhancements in order to update product documentation and release notes for each product release.
prepare draft content for the what’s new guide, including screenshots. 
install, upgrade and maintain the product installations. familiarity with windows os and ms sql would be an asset.
publish final versions of all documentation from madcap flare and ms word (via adobe acrobat) for each release and co-ordinate distribution to customer and partner portals.
prepare custom online help content and pdf guides based on specific customer requirements.
work with technical services and support teams to edit, publish and maintain tech notes.
log any software bugs found during the documentation process and verify closure.
address all documentation-related issues and verify closure with the user who has submitted the change/fix.
create vba to format and clean up word documents and shell scripts to parse and compare information to create release notes. 
familiarity with documenting apis. ideally, be able to configure and use the product api to document api features.
familiarity with creating video content of product feature for both instructional and marketing purposes. 

requirements:

4+ years of experience working as a technical writer;
2+ years working for a software technology company;
experience with any or all of the following would be an asset:



madcap flare, adobe acrobat,       microsoft office, microsoft visio;
camtasia, mindflash, captivate;
html, css for working with madcap       flare
svn or github
virtualization technologies (i.e.       vmware);
altassian jira, confluence and       bamboo;
agile software development       process; 



must be comfortable working in an open area environment.

 if you are interested is this position, please submit your resume by email to careers@densify.com.
          in the subject title please quote technical writer. electronic correspondence only – no agencies or telephone calls please. 
we thank all applicants who apply, but only qualified candidates will be contacted directly to schedule an interview.
 
data and reporting analyst
department: product management
level: intermediate            
location: richmond hill, on

as a data and reporting analyst, you will create and customize dashboards and reporting solutions used to optimize costs, resource allocations and placements in cloud and data center environments. as a member of the product management team you will collaborate with the engineering, services, sales and documentation teams by acting as a resident expert for reporting and dashboards and often get involved in fast-paced rapid prototyping activities.
general responsibilities:

based on design      ideas from pm team members and other teams, quickly create compelling      dashboards and reports using tibco jaspersoft jasperserver pro reporting      engine integrated into densify solution.
design and document      data domains necessary to power reports and dashboards.  establish and maintain excellent      understanding of reporting tables and other data sources holding key metrics      used for reporting and dashboards and best way to access and aggregate this      information.
develop and      maintain excellent knowledge of custom and standard reports and data      domains previously developed by yourself and others.  implement common design standards and      consistent styling across such element as much as possible by acting as a      subject matter expert in this area.
actively share      knowledge by developing draft documentation and conducting training in the      area of report/dashboard design and associated data domains creation.
get involved in      rapid prototyping activities requiring reports/dashboards customization to      quickly address new customer requirements.
work with sales and      services team members, other densify employees and customers to capture unique      reporting needs of various user roles.
work with      engineering team to help quickly leverage new product features in existing      and reports/dashboards.
log and investigate      and help address issues with custom reports and dashboards as well as any      related base product issues.          

requirements:

good working experience with reporting and/or business intelligence solutions (tibco’s jaspersoft preferred)
proven ability in designing compelling reports and dashboards to present key information and metrics in the most appropriate manner considering factors such as

the consumers role (e.g. executive vs. system administrator)
nature of report (e.g. informational vs. call to action)
and any other relevant factors.

proven ability to understand data models and aggregate information from different sources in order to appropriately populate reports and dashboards.  
experience with relational databases and sql.
experience with reporting on it infrastructure, capacity management is desirable.
conceptual knowledge of virtualization and cloud technologies (e.g. aws) is a bonus
experience with software deployment and associated tools (e.g. source code management systems, code development frameworks etc.) is a bonus
ability to manage      multiple priorities
strong oral communication skills and technical writing skills
strong team player and enjoys working in a fast paced team atmosphere
familiarity with the agile/scrum software development process is an asset

 if you are interested is this position, please submit your resume by email to careers@densify.com.
          in the subject title please quote data and reporting analyst . electronic correspondence only – no agencies or telephone calls please. 
we thank all applicants who apply, but only qualified candidates will be contacted directly to schedule an interview.






 









sales
pre-sales specialist
level: junior - intermediate
department: sales
location: richmond hill 
with a great reception in the market, densify is expanding its entire go-to-market effort including pre-sales in order to pursue this strategic high-growth opportunity.
we are current looking to fill the role of a pre-sales technical specialist to join our team. working with sales executives and our business development group, the pre-sales technical specialist will provide pre-sales coverage throughout the saas sales cycle. 
the position requires strong technical foundation combined with excellent presentation and pre-sales skills.  the successful candidate will possess conceptual and analysis skills, planning abilities, sound judgment, innovation, excellent writing skills, and superior communication skills. this position will be based in richmond hill and report to the vp, technical sales. the position requires occasional north american travel (approximately 10%). 
general responsibilities: 

deliver all technical phases of a saas-drive sales cycle. this involves preparing and delivering sales presentations, performing software demonstrations, managing all phases of prospect proof of concept projects including preparation and delivery of poc summary documents and presentations, performing competitive research, and coordinating and preparing rfi/rfp responses. 
occasionally deliver on premise technical workshops and ad-hoc training. 
regular prospect and partner interaction via telephone, email, web meetings and in-person contact. 
work closely with cross-functional teams including sales, business development,  customer care, and product management.
define, coordinate, and prioritize prospect and partner feedback and ideas into product management requirements for future enhancements to densify's products and services.

minimum requirements:

3+ years experience in an enterprise software company and hands-on experience with large scale enterprise data center management / hypervisor software sales and/or deployments 
3+ years pre-sales experience in a related field 
exceptional written and verbal communication skills and strong presentation skills are critical 
ability to manage multiple priorities, commitments and projects 
a bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field is strongly preferred 

technical  requirements:

hands-on experience with hybrid cloud technologies; in particular, vmware experience is mandatory. microsoft azure. amazon aws, powervm , openstack or equivalent knowledge is highly desirable 
experience with heterogeneous bare metal environments and operating systems (windows, linux, unix etc.) 
experience with relational databases (sql server or oracle preferred) desirable
experience with scripting and programing languages desirable
proficiency with microsoft office suite and salesforce crm 

personal attributes: 

adaptable team player who enjoys working in a fast-paced team atmosphere 
business acumen and great attitude - loves working with prospects to drive value creation for our customers and for densify
detail-oriented - you enjoy learning new technologies in great depth so that you can in turn help our customers solve problems and realize significant value
self-motivated - you like autonomy and work well under pressure

if you are interested is this position, please submit your resume by email to careers@densify.com. in the subject title please quote pre-sales specialist.  electronic correspondence only – no agencies or telephone calls please. 
we thank all applicants who apply, but only qualified candidates will be contacted directly to schedule an interview. 
 
 
account development representative 
department: sales
level: junior - intermediate
location: toronto, on 
we are seeking an account development representative (adr) to join a fast paced, high energy team at a growing software organization.  the ideal candidate will be responsible for account prospecting efforts which will translate into tangible revenue-generating opportunities via phone, email, and other social channels.  the adr will engage in a close loop reporting with management and sales teams while maintaining a high level understanding of densify products.  understanding client challenges, key industry imperatives while demonstrating an enthusiastic and results-driven attitude with an attention to detail is critical. 

general responsibilities:

high volume prospecting into multiple organizations via cold-calling, networking, e-mail, in-bound leads as well as utilizing internet information sources to the opportunity pipeline
articulate densify’s value proposition to decision-makers across multiple industries to assess buying interest
clearly articulate products and solutions with prospective customers to successfully manage and overcome objections
meet and exceed daily, weekly, and quarterly goals consisting of contacts, meetings, and sales opportunities
heavy use of salesforce.com, and additional applications to manage all lead data and ensure data integrity
qualifying marketing leads generated through the web, trade shows, and other programs
maintaining the database, including comprehensive data entry, setting alarms for follow-up, lead tracking and hand-off 
maintaining current knowledge of densify’s products/services and competitive differentiators

requirements:

 bachelor's degree
excellent written and verbal communication skills
solid microsoft office skills
experience using a crm solution such as salesforce.com
ability to meet or exceed individual goals set by team manager
must be highly self-motivated, detail-oriented, organized, and flexible 
positive attitude, with the desire to work in a rapid-growth, entrepreneurial environment 

if you are interested is this position, please submit your resume by email to careers@densify.com. in the subject title please quote account development representative .  electronic correspondence only – no agencies or telephone calls please. 
we thank all applicants who apply, but only qualified candidates will be contacted directly to schedule an interview. 










technical services
technical consultant
department: technical services 
level: intermediate
reports to: director, technical services
location: toronto, on
we are seeking a technical consultant to join the technical services team at densify inc. the consultant will focus on delivering consulting services. consulting services include the installation, configuration, integration, customization, and operation of our enterprise transformational and operational analysis software.  in addition, the role will involve training customers and partners, as well as pre and post-sale technical product support.
the position requires strong conceptual and analysis skills, planning abilities, sound judgment, teamwork, leadership, innovation, excellent writing skills, and superior communication and presentation skills.
general responsibilities:

manage product rollouts including installation, configuration, integration, customization and validation within customer environments and for partner assessments.
provide post-sale technical support evaluating customer readiness; conducting product training; identifying and resolving application or environmental issues.
work closely with and manage client-specific cross-functional teams composed of engineering, sales, client services, and business development representatives. 
take a technical management role for partners by providing assistance in engagement and deployment planning, data collection, and analysis in customer environments. 
define, coordinate, and prioritize customer and partner feedback and ideas into product management requirements for future enhancements to densify's products and services. 
play an active role within the department by participating in process development and other business improvement projects.
regular client and partner interaction via telephone, email, and regular face-to-face contact.
work independently with customer/partner technical teams on post sales activities.
work with client services team members and the training service department to update and develop training materials.
deliver classroom and web-based instructor facilitated technical product training to densify partners and customers across the globe.

requirements:

5+ years’ experience in an enterprise software company and hands-on experience with large scale enterprise software rollouts
4+ years’ experience in a consulting capacity
demonstrated ability to understand a complex distributed software system with sufficient depth to troubleshoot highly technical, time sensitive issues
experience with heterogeneous environments including windows, unix and linux
experience with virtualization technologies (vmware, ibm pseries, hyper-v, xen, etc…)
experience with relational databases (sql server or oracle preferred)
up to 40% travel is required for this position

nice to have:

a b.s or m.s in computer science or a related field is strongly preferred
strong aix and ibm power virtualization experience
experience with scripting and programing languages

personal attributes:

strong verbal communication skills and excellent technical writing skills
strong team player and enjoys working in a fast paced team atmosphere
ability to manage multiple priorities, commitments and projects
ability to communicate complex ideas verbally and through documentation
must be able to grasp highly technical concepts quickly, develop content, and independently document features for target audiences

if you are interested is this position, please submit your resume by email to careers@densify.com. in the subject title please quote technical consultant .  electronic correspondence only – no agencies or telephone calls please. 
we thank all applicants who apply, but only qualified candidates will be contacted directly to schedule an interview. 










customer success
customer success manager
department: customer success 
level: intermediate
location: toronto, on
with a great reception in the market, densify is expanding its entire go-to-market effort including customer success to pursue this strategic high-growth opportunity. we are building a customer success team from the ground up and it’s an exciting time to join!
we’re looking for a customer success manager who is obsessed with customer value. you will be a main point of contact to ensure our customers are deriving massive value from working with densify. we are looking for someone who loves technology, learning the ins and outs of products, and working with customers to solve business problems. when you search "customer success", you will come across topics such as managing churn risk, upselling to achieve negative revenue churn, and managing product adoption to increase retention. these are all inward looking metrics. at densify, you will work with a team of professionals who believe that customer retention, expansion and advocacy is the result and not the reason of the hard work we put in everyday helping our customers solve problems they are passionate about.
general responsibilities:

own overall relationship with assigned clients, which include: increasing adoption, ensuring retention, and satisfaction.
establish a trusted advisor relationship with each assigned client and drive continued value of our products and services.
develop, prepare, and nurture customers for advocacy.
work with customers to establish critical goals, or other key performance indicators and aid the customer in achieving their goals.
work to identify and/or develop upsell opportunities.
advocate customer needs/issues cross-departmentally.
program manage account escalations.

requirements:

3 - 5 years experience minimum in technical customer-facing positions as a presales engineer, professional services consultant, or customer success manager. 
strong knowledge of software as a service (saas) products and services, broadly defined
proven ability to onboard a customer or deliver training classes remotely and on site to customer teams, confidently sharing knowledge and answering technical questions. 

at least one of the followings:

understanding of hardware architecture and infrastructure design 
experience in linux / windows / unix system administration, technical architecture, or virtualization technologies (vmware, openstack, etc)
extensive knowledge of aws and one of azure, google or softlayer cloud offerings and an ability to explain the difference between their service offerings, catalogue options and associated pricing structures.
experience in the deployment and management of applications running on a public cloud provider.

personal attributes:

amazing customer service attitude - you must love helping people
strong technical aptitude- densify’s products help our customers solve complex it problems and you will be our customers’ trusted technology advisor
detail-oriented - you enjoy learning densify’s products in great depth so that you can in turn help our customers use our products to solve problems
self motivated - you like autonomy and work well under pressure
business acumen - loves working with customers to drive value creation for our customers and for densify

if you are interested is this position, please submit your resume by email to careers@densify.com. in the subject title please quote  customer success manager.  electronic correspondence only – no agencies or telephone calls please. 
we thank all applicants who apply, but only qualified candidates will be contacted directly to schedule an interview. 
 
customer cloud advisor
department: customer success team 
level: intermediate
location: richmond hill, on
due to rapid growth densify is actively seeking a customer cloud advisor who will be responsible for advising customers on how to optimize their cloud infrastructure by leveraging the analytics and insights provided by our saas software. the advisor will work with the densify sales and customer success managers to ensure customers understand and take advantage of densify’s recommendations. as well as the advisor’s intimate knowledge of the key cloud provider’s services offerings, catalogue options, buying and pricing structures. the successful candidate will be supporting global fortune 1000 customers as they expand their use of the public cloud.          
general responsibilities:

provide advice and guidance as the densify cloud subject matter expert to ensure customers successfully optimize their cloud infrastructure through ongoing usage and adoption of densify capabilities
continual learning and research to keep current on the cloud providers iaas and paas offerings and pricing
work with the sales representatives and customer success managers, to undertake discovery and analysis of a client’s existing cloud usage and provide valuable advice and recommendations
function as a frontline technical resource for “best practice” and informal customer questions
engage with customer support as a customer advocate to ensure speedy resolution of customer issues
engage with product management as the customer advocate on product roadmap discussions
maintain current functional and technical knowledge of densify capabilities.

requirements:

extensive knowledge of aws and one of azure, google or softlayer cloud offerings and an ability to explain the difference between their service offerings, catalogue options and associated pricing structures.
experience in the deployment and management of applications running on a public cloud provider.
5+ years of direct customer engagement experience with a software or service provider in post-sales or professional services organizations is required.
successfully managed customer engagements to completion and customer satisfaction
excellent analytical skills & problem solving skills, combined with the ability to provide quick resolution to problems.
exceptional verbal and written organizational, presentation, and communication skills
must be customer service oriented and believe in teamwork, collaboration, adaptability & initiative
demonstrable success in thinking strategically, executing tactically while providing consistent and high levels of customer satisfaction and retention in a fast paced environment
willingness to travel periodically based on customer and business need (approximately 10%)
experience with multiple operating systems including windows, unix and linux; and with virtualization technologies from 1 or more suppliers

 preferred credentials: 

aws trained
aws certified
b.s. degree in an engineering and / or technical discipline from an accredited college / university required: computer science, computer / electrical engineering, industrial and systems engineering, mechanical engineering

if you are interested is this position, please submit your resume by email to careers@densify.com. in the subject title please quote customer cloud advisor.  electronic correspondence only – no agencies or telephone calls please. 
we thank all applicants who apply, but only qualified candidates will be contacted directly to schedule an interview.

are you the one?
here at blakely, we’re looking for someone who loves pouring through facts and figures to find meaningful nuggets and then sharing these discoveries with the team and clients. if this is the job that you’ve been waiting for, blakely inc. has an opening for a business intelligence professional with:

strong ability to extract, transform and analyze data in a variety of formats from both client and internal sources
experience working with analysis and visualization software (r preferred)
skilled in visual storytelling through clear concise reports, dashboards and presentations
ability to translate requests from, and communicate findings to, non-technical end-users
background in analysis for marketing or fundraising (ideally in an agency environment)

if, in addition to your experience, you are a collaborative team player, problem solver, extremely well organized and detail-oriented – then we want you at blakely.
your remuneration package will be tailored to fit your experience and skills.

job details
qa analyst


location   toronto                        , ontario, canada
category   information technology


job
                            opened   09/18/2017
education   bachelor's degree                    


job number   17000c0o                    
job type   full time



job description
 
company description
 
hudson’s bay company is one of the fastest-growing department store retailers in the world.  in north america, hbc’s leading banners include hudson’s bay, lord & taylor, saks fifth avenue, gilt, saks off 5th, find @ lord & taylor, and home outfitters. in europe, hbc’s banners include galeria kaufhof (the largest department store group in germany), galeria inno (belgium’s only department store group), and sportarena. at hbc we are a company of adventurers who explore uncharted territory, challenge convention, and work with imagination and fun.
 
major responsibilities
the qa analyst will be responsible for day-to-day test preparation and test execution activities.  the qa analyst will be responsible for the validation of front-end and back-end systems.  this includes understanding processes and functionality, knowledge of the overall system, mapping of required interfaces, and understanding of data requirements.  this role requires the individual to work closely with offshore qa manager and/or test lead in the creation and execution of test deliverables, analysis of test results, detection and documentation of defects, and validation of bug fixes.   
 
role responsibilities include:


manage and execute complex test scenarios.

responsible for the creation of testing artifacts including but not limited to test cases, test scripts, test conditions, and expected test results.

responsible for mapping of test cases to business requirements and functional designs.

creating and reviewing testing deliverables.

documentation of test execution results.

performing negative testing.

troubleshooting and reviewing log/queues.  documentation of test results and defect reports.

attending daily stand-up meetings with project team providing detailed analysis when requested.

verification of environments.

using appropriate qa test management tools.

working with onshore teams to obtain needful information.

support qa manager / test lead as required.

team player.

deliver on time.
qualifications
 
personal characteristics
 
the successful candidate should be a respected and proven with a quantifiable track record of success in delivering results within a large complex organization.  he/she must have the ability to quickly assess a new environment and develop solutions that support the business strategy, critical objectives, and cultural norms. he/she must be creative with a strategic mindset along with the ability to turn concepts into action.  he/she must have strong relationship building and influence skills.  the successful candidate will be a change agent who is flexible, resilient, and able to thrive in a dynamic, rapid paced environment. he/she will embody a culture of taking smart risks and innovating to win.
 
professional qualifications


bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g. computer science, electrical engineering).

possesses a minimum of 2-3 years of qa experience, including testing experience.

good understanding of testing methodologies and testing processes.  familiar with testing tools such as hp products.

understands software development life cycle process and various testing techniques including a proficiency in system testing.

strong aptitude for learning new technologies.

work collaboratively within a cross-functional team.

good documentation and communication skills.

attention to detail.

ability to work off-business hours as needed.

knowledge of basic sql.

experience in retail.

background in either stores, hr, finance, logistics, and edw.

mobile web and web test automation experience with selenium webdriver. 

experience in testing api’s (rest, soap or application proprietary api’s). 

working knowledge of scripting or programming languages (e.g. python, javascript, java).

experience in using or maintaining testing frameworks.

experience in test data management.experience in retail.

quantitative analyst
department overview:
the quantitative analytics group (qag) supports the entire information division in markit and offers expertise on all quantitative issues within the company. using a broad range of mathematical and statistical techniques in conjunction with technology, we develop all types of models for various businesses such as portfolio valuations, cds data, indices, structured finance, otc derived data. applications include derivatives valuation, risk calculations, data cleaning algorithms, fair value, scenario analysis, etc.
position summary
the candidate will work with other experienced quantitative analysts, developers and product specialists to support and develop models to be used in the creation and improvement of market data products for several business lines within the information division, in particular the otc derived data team.  the methods will be a combination of financial modelling and statistical techniques, with particular emphasis on bayesian inference schemes.

duties & accountabilities
contribute to improvements on existing models and processes used daily in derivative pricing and/or market data product creation and dissemination.
work with other quants, product specialists and developers to develop new models as required by various businesses within the information division.  particular projects may arise in any derivative asset class (fixed income, equity, credit, commodity) or in non-derivative areas (bond pricing and analytics, indices).
business competencies




education and experience


msc/phd in a quantitative subject e.g. math, physics, computer science
experience with derivatives pricing models and/or risk models.
knowledge of mathematical finance, stochastic calculus, probability theory, pdes
experience with numerical methods such as monte carlo, finite differences
familiarity with object oriented programming (eg. java / c++)
strong problem solving skills
high level of attention to detail




commercial awareness


n/a




management requirements


n/a





personal competencies




personal impact


detail oriented and self-starter




communication


ability to clearly communicate sophisticated concepts




teamwork


ability to work in a team environment, and across different functional teams




company overview
ihs markit harnesses deep sources of information, analytics and expertise to forge solutions for the industries and markets that drive global economies. our company partners with clients in business, finance and government to provide the unrivalled insights and perspectives that lead to well-informed, confident decisions. we call this the new intelligence.
ihs markit serves more than 50,000 key customers in more than 140 countries, including 80 percent of the fortune global 500.  we help decision makers apply higher-level thinking to daily tasks and strategic issues across a host of industries and disciplines including energy, finance, automotive, engineering, technology, maritime and trade, aerospace and defense, chemical, and economics and country risk. 
headquartered in london, ihs markit (nasdaq: info) is committed to sustainable, profitable growth.                              





job segment: 
quantitative analyst, equity, engineer, computer science, data, engineering, finance, technology, automotive

data scientist 
 
alberta energy regulator  
details 











 


openings
 1 


location name


                            alberta energy regulator                            

                            calgary, alberta, ca                            



date posted
sep 18, 2017


profession
science specialist


experience level(s)

                    not specified                    


job type(s)
permanent


education level(s)
university - bachelors


job id
job-2207



 

position summary
the reserves group drives, supports, and monitors superior regulatory decisions in the area of subsurface management, resource conservation and optimization.  it provides unbiased and credible information about alberta’s energy reserves and resources.    the group is also responsible for driving division and enterprise projects leading to orderly development and effective regulation of subsurface development.  our group classifies reserves and subsurface pore-space in terms of economic value, and forecasts future development scenarios and trajectories of the subsurface to integrate with economic, environmental, and social factors.                    
the reserves data science team is seeking a data scientist responsible for driving the integration of cots solutions and in-house technology and data to support prototypes of advanced analytics and machine learning for reserves workflows.  through the use of data analytics, the data scientist will support branch projects in data visualization, advanced statistics, predictive analytics, machine learning, and preparation of long-term future development scenarios, including performance for planning and economic purposes.   the data scientist will develop new visualization and educational products to help non-technical stakeholders appreciate and incorporate subsurface information into their decision-making.
responsibilities/duties:


drive the integration of technology into reserves workflows to add value and increase efficiency in the business process.


develop advanced analytics to rapidly improve the ability for geoscientists, engineers, technologists, and technicians to access the critical data needed to make good decisions.


mentor junior data scientists and reserves analysts and foster creativity within the team by contributing innovative solutions to complex problems.




support relational database systems, gis datasets, and full communication between data depositories. ensure preliminary set-up and flexing/testing of numerous databases.




create synergies between the information services branch and business partners and conceptualize database architecture to support future reserves workflows.




liaise with business experts to develop a systemic understanding of the geology and reserves portfolio.




prepare and present technical presentations for senior leadership, industry and other stakeholders.


qualifications:  


a degree in computer science or related engineering or geoscience discipline, with 5 – 10 years of related experience


preference is given to those with a post-secondary degree and related technical certification


domain expertise in the alberta oil and gas industry and/or regulatory environment


high proficiency with a variety of programming languages such as r, python, and scala


demonstrated ability to work with unstructured or incomplete datasets


solid understanding of data mining techniques such as advanced clustering and association rules


experience in developing and deploying machine learning and statistical models to end users


ability to develop solutions with tibco spotfire would be considered an asset


familiar with distributed computing tools such as hadoop, apache  spark or mapreduce


team player with strong collaboration skills who adapts to a dynamic diverse work environment


insatiably curious and not afraid to challenge the status quo


join the alberta energy regulator and be in great company! 
a career should fulfill many needs. in a team of world-class thinkers who regulate how energy resources are discovered, developed and delivered your reward can go beyond a job well done. it can go to the pride and recognition that you’re doing something that matters. 
for 75 years alberta’s oil and gas regulator has adapted to meet innovations in technology, new industry activity and changing social expectations. 
we are seeking diverse individuals with strong technical skills to join us in this exciting journey. be everything you want to be by helping us build a legacy of excellence albertans can count on. 
how to apply:
please quote competition # 17-140 in your application.
please note: should an individual with the required qualifications not be available, applicants with closely related qualifications may be considered. relocation costs covered by the aer will be considered on an individual basis.
#li-post 




applications are being accepted until october 08, 2017
